page.title: 04Croxton Parish
page.content: Croxton is a small village of 3 farms and 15 houses.One farm and 3 houses are privately owned, the rest of the property in the Parish apart from the Church,is owned by the Earl of Yarborough.The Farms are predominatly Arable but some cattle and horses are grazed near the village. A new house was built in 1983. This was the first new building in the village for over 100 years.Stringent planning conditions had to be met, because either side of the new house are some yellow brick distinctive Yarborough Estate Cottages.No further development is expected.49 people live in the parish and all except 3 of the men work in Agriculture. Croxton's only facility is a fine church, no Pub,Shop or Bus Service. Youngerschool children until 11 go to Kirmington. Older children are bused to Brigg.
